#summary Guidelines for establishing a fair, efficient, and useful ontology review process.
#labels Editorial

This page deals with policies and guidelines for the process of ontology review, particularly operational aspects such as:

 * which ontologies should be reviewed, and in what order?
 * how should reviewers be chosen?
 * how will conflicts be resolved?

[http://code.google.com/p/obo-foundry-operations-committee/wiki/ReviewCriteriaPolicies ReviewCriteriaPolicies] covers guidelines and policies for the criteria by which an ontology should be reviewed.

= Ontology review priority = 

Ontologies will be reviewed in the order in which the review request is received. If an ontology previously submitted a request for an OBO Foundry review (that is, before this committee was formed), then the date of the original request is used to determine priority.

Any ontology group wanting a review by the Editorial WG must submit a request on the [http://code.google.com/p/obo-foundry-operations-committee/issues/list issue tracker]

= How to request an ontology review =

  # Go to the OBO Foundry Operations Committee [http://code.google.com/p/obo-foundry-operations-committee/issues/list issue tracker].
  # Click on "New issue".
  # Select the "Review request" template and follow the instructions on the template.
